intro: Pentachaeta exilis subsp. aeolica, commonly known as the slender pentachaeta, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its slender stems and narrow leaves are adapted to withstand arid conditions and strong winds.
